vocabulary.description: foaf:OnlineAccount's can have an accountName, but plenty of services use an account identifier internally that is not the same as the public account name: for instance, Twitter uses a nickname and a user_id property. Facebook now assigns usernames as well as internal identification numbers. Google's various services assign a unique identifier so that people are not revealing their e-mail address or username. This property is for these kind of identifiers.
vocabulary.semantics: Having this property implies being a foaf:OnlineAccount.

vocabulary.description: A person who is licensed in at least one ITU region to operate (transmit and receive) a radio using frequencies and modes permitted only to licensed persons.
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of foaf:Person.

vocabulary.description: Database for Biologists (Bioinformatics)
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of Scientific Database.

vocabulary.description: A business card associated with this resource.
vocabulary.semantics: Every value of this property is a vcard:VCard. It is equivalent to hcard:hasCard.

vocabulary.description: A calendar associated with this resource.
Relates class to a class skeleton. If class has more than one of this relations, it should use them all.
vocabulary.semantics: Having this property implies being a rdfs:Class. Every value of this property is a Class Skeleton. It is a sub-property of Class Skeleton Ignore.

vocabulary.description: A location from which a distance is measured. (A distance measurement will have two points, and a distance measurement value).
vocabulary.semantics: Having this property implies being a Distance. Every value of this property is a geo:SpatialThing.

vocabulary.description: The song that is the focus of a particular earworm
vocabulary.semantics: This property is functional. Having this property implies being an Earworm. Every value of this property is a mo:MusicalWork. It is the inverse of Is Song of Earworm

vocabulary.description: Associates a resource with a form that can be used to edit its description. See http://patterns.dataincubator.org/book/edit-trail.html for more information.
vocabulary.semantics: Every value of this property is a foaf:Document.

vocabulary.description: The first sentence of a resource.
vocabulary.semantics: Every value of this property is a rdfs:Literal.

vocabulary.description: The name used when referred to in formal situations, e.g. Mr. Davis
vocabulary.semantics: It is a sub-property of Name.

vocabulary.description: Slang for loves.
vocabulary.semantics: Having this property implies being a foaf:Agent. Every value of this property is an owl:Thing.

vocabulary.description: Structure in which someone lives
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of ov:building. No member of this class can also be a member of ov:horse. Having HouseColor implies being a member of this class. It is equivalent to ov:domicile.

vocabulary.description: a pictorial representation for something.
vocabulary.semantics: Every value of this property is a foaf:Image.

vocabulary.description: A statement that would be illegal to express in a non-reified form in RDF/XML - usually because the predicate cannot be converted to a QName.
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of rdf:Statement.

other-info.markdown: For example: [] rdf:type openvocab:IllegalRDFXMLStatement ; rdf:subject //example.com/some_competition> ; rdf:predicate //example.com/prizes/1> ; rdf:object //example.com/some_person> . Tools *may* automatically convert between openvocab:IllegalRDFXMLStatement statements and unreified statements when parsing or serialising RDF/XML.[en]

vocabulary.description: A gorilla that kills or has the inclination to do so.
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of umbel:Gorilla. No member of this class can also be a member of Non Killer-Gorilla.

vocabulary.description: The number of kilometres of a distance measurement.
vocabulary.semantics: Every value of this property is a xsd:decimal.

vocabulary.description: Indicates that the subject is a non-deceased killer gorilla.
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of Killer Gorilla. No member of this class can also be a member of Non Killer-Gorilla.

other-info.markdown: Zombie killer gorillas are an edge case. It is hoped that we'll be able to decide how they are modelled once we gain more experience in this area.[en]

vocabulary.description: A person's maiden name.
vocabulary.semantics: Having this property implies being a foaf:Person. Every value of this property is a rdfs:Literal.

vocabulary.description: A post on a microblogging service like Twitter, identi.ca, Jaiku or FriendFeed. Usually untitled and with a limited number of characters, and sometimes containing in-line text-based syntactical elements like at-replies, hashtags, group 'bangtags' etc.
vocabulary.semantics: It is equivalent to types:MicroblogPost.

vocabulary.description: x is 'near' y if they are near to each other in physical space, for a deliberately vague notion of near.
vocabulary.semantics: This property is symmetrical. Having this property implies being a geo:SpatialThing. Every value of this property is a geo:SpatialThing.

vocabulary.description: Indicates that something is definitely not a Killer-Gorilla. (It may still be a killer though. Or a gorilla.)
vocabulary.semantics: Being a member of this class implies also being a member of owl:Thing. No member of this class can also be a member of Killer Gorilla.

vocabulary.description: A plot of anything.
Semester in which the course is offered.
vocabulary.semantics: Having this property implies being a Course.

vocabulary.description: A set of terms or names, each one having an assigned meaning.
